homes_hear_details: New Mexico has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The New Mexico Energy, Minerals and Natural Resources Department (EMNRD) is working with the U.S. Department of Energy on program design and deployment.
state_energy_office: New Mexico Energy, Minerals and Natural Resources Department (EMNRD)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For New Mexico, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Bernalillo County (Albuquerque), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $55,950. Rural counties may be lower.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For New Mexico, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Bernalillo County (Albuquerque), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $104,900.

net_metering: New Mexico has net metering rules for systems up to 80 MW. Residential customers receive full retail rate credit for excess generation. Credits carry forward month to month with an annual true-up, and any remaining credits are granted to the utility.

state_tax_credits.name: New Mexico Solar Market Development Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: 10% of the cost of a solar system, up to $6,000 (originally $9,000 before 2024 adjustments)
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar photovoltaic systems and solar thermal systems installed on residential property
state_tax_credits.details: New Mexico offers a personal income tax credit for the installation of solar energy systems. The credit can be carried forward for up to 10 years if it exceeds tax liability in a given year.

state_tax_credits.name: New Mexico Sustainable Building Tax Credit
state_tax_credits.amount: Up to $5.00 per square foot for new residential construction meeting Build Green NM Silver or higher standards
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: New construction or major renovations meeting sustainable building standards
state_tax_credits.details: Available for homes built to sustainable building standards. Credit amount depends on the level of certification achieved.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,000 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through community action agencies and non-profit organizations.

top_utilities.name: PNM (Public Service Company of New Mexico)

programs.name: PNM Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $800 for heat pumps, $400 for insulation, $100 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, insulation, duct sealing, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances

programs.name: PNM Home Energy Checkup
programs.eligible_items: Home energy evaluation identifying savings opportunities and available rebates

programs.name: Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $600 for HVAC, $300 for insulation, $75 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, insulation, duct sealing, smart thermostats

programs.name: Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for high-efficiency furnaces, $300 for water heaters
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency natural gas furnaces, tankless water heaters, smart thermostats
